title: "Join CINAS"

CINAS operates on an open innovation model. We are looking for curious minds and strategic partners.

::: {.callout-important icon=false}

[{{< fa atom >}}]{.text-primary} Special Call: Physics-Informed ML (Health and Nuclear)

We are specifically looking for researchers and students to join our new Physics-Informed Machine Learning line.

Areas of Interest:

Medical Imaging: Application of physical laws in image reconstruction.

Nuclear Technology: Inverse problems in neutron tomography.
:::

For Students (Master's and PhD)

Joining CINAS means working at the intersection of Computing and Radiation Sciences.

What you will develop:

Multilingual Computational Fluency: Mastery of Python, R, and C/C++.

Scientific Rigor: Deep understanding of radiation physics.

Innovation Vision: Ability to create solutions for real-world problems.

::: {.callout-note}

Interested?

Send your CV (or Lattes) and a brief letter of intent to our contact email, mentioning which research line interests you most.
:::

For Partners

We seek collaboration for technology validation and co-development.

What We Are Looking For Now

Academic Partners in PIML: Researchers interested in collaborating on the foundations of Physics-Informed ML.

Hospitals: Access to anonymized clinical data and clinical validation.

International Exchange: Research groups in Nuclear Digital Twin or Medical AI.
